alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 19 at 11:24AM MST until January 20 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River at Calva affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Calva...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall earlier in the week continues. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River at Calva. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Low-lying riparian areas flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MST Thursday the stage was 10 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet late tonight. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Gila River Gila River at Calv 20.0 10 Thur 10 am MST 16.3 10.0 7.0 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM MST.
